perturbation.original_text:
1.4.  Confidential Information shall mean, subject to the provisions of
Section 9.2  [Exclusions], all proprietary and confidential information of a Party, including,
without limitation, trade secrets, technical information, business information,
sales information, customer and potential customer lists and identities, product
sales plans, sublicense agreements, inventions, developments, discoveries,
software, know-how, methods, techniques, formulae, data, processes and other
proprietary ideas, whether or not protectable under patent, trademark, copyright
or other areas of law, that the other Party has access to or receives. For
purposes of this Agreement, this Agreement shall be considered Confidential
Information.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.4.  Confidential Information shall mean all information a party may share with another party, regardless of whether it is explicitly marked as confidential or not. This includes, but is not limited to, business strategies, customer data, marketing plans, and financial information. This definition applies unless both parties mutually agree in writing to exclude specific information from this definition. For purposes of this Agreement, this Agreement shall be considered Confidential Information.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Confidential Information' was qualified by Section 9.2 [Exclusions], allowing certain types of information to be excluded. The modified version removes this qualification and broadens the definition to include almost all information shared, creating a contradiction with Section 9.2 if it remains unchanged. This introduces uncertainty about what is truly confidential and complicates enforcement of confidentiality obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
6.5.  Guaranteed Revenues. VerticalNet agrees to guarantee that, during the
initial Term of this Agreement, LeadersOnline shall earn LeadersOnline-
VerticalNet Revenue of at least *** Dollars ($***) (the "Guaranteed Amount"),
subject to the provisions of this Section 6.5  [Guaranteed Revenues]. *** Within thirty (30) days after
the end of the initial Term, LeadersOnline shall submit a statement showing a
reasonably detailed accounting of the LeadersOnline-VerticalNet Revenue received
during the initial Term (or earned during the initial Term and paid within 30
days thereafter) along with payment of all such amounts up to the Guaranteed
Amount. In the event this Agreement is terminated in accordance with Section
7.1  [DEFINITIONS], LeadersOnline shall make a payment of all amounts of LeadersOnline-
VerticalNet Revenues received through the date of termination, up to the amount
of the Guaranteed Amount ***.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.5.  Guaranteed Revenues. VerticalNet will endeavor to assist LeadersOnline in generating LeadersOnline-VerticalNet Revenue. The Parties agree that VerticalNet does not guarantee a minimum amount of LeadersOnline-VerticalNet Revenue during the initial term of this agreement. LeadersOnline's financial success is directly correlated to LeadersOnline's efforts.
perturbation.explanation: The original text guarantees a minimum revenue amount for LeadersOnline. The modified text explicitly states that VerticalNet does not guarantee any minimum revenue. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the revenue guarantee, leading to uncertainty about VerticalNet's financial obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
7.4.  LeadersOnline shall have the option, subject to VerticalNet's approval
exercised in its sole  and absolute discretion, to extend the Term of this
Agreement for an additional 12 months (a "Renewal Term") on such terms and
conditions as may be mutually agreed upon by the Parties. To exercise this
option, LeadersOnline must notify VerticalNet in writing of its election no
later than 90 days prior to the expiration of the initial Term. Unless
VerticalNet notifies LeadersOnline of its intention to extend the initial Term
of this Agreement for an additional year within 30 days of receiving such notice
the Agreement shall terminate in accordance with the terms hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.4.  LeadersOnline shall have the option to extend the Term of this Agreement for successive Renewal Terms of 12 months each. To exercise this option, LeadersOnline must notify VerticalNet in writing of its election no later than 90 days prior to the expiration of the then-current Term. VerticalNet's approval is not required for any Renewal Term. Unless LeadersOnline notifies VerticalNet of its intention to terminate the Agreement in writing no later than 30 days prior to the expiration of the then-current Term, the Agreement shall automatically renew for an additional 12 months.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause stated that LeadersOnline's option to renew was subject to VerticalNet's sole and absolute discretion. The modified clause removes VerticalNet's approval requirement and institutes automatic renewals unless LeadersOnline provides notice of termination. This is a direct contradiction, as the original text gives VerticalNet complete control over renewal, while the modified text shifts control to LeadersOnline with an automatic renewal mechanism. The conflicting language generates confusion about renewal terms.
